title: Relationships
description: Examine your family, friends, and social connections

submodules.title: Mapping My Network
submodules.description: Identify and map your key relationships

activities.title: Relationship Mapping
activities.description: Map out your key relationships and their impact on your recovery

content.prompt: Think about the important relationships in your life - family, friends, romantic partners, mentors, or others. Consider how these relationships support or challenge your recovery journey.
followUpQuestions: Who are the most important people in your life right now?
Which relationships feel most supportive of your recovery?
Which relationships feel challenging or unsupportive?
How do these relationships influence your relationship with food and your body?

reflectionPrompts.title: My Support System
reflectionPrompts.prompt: Reflect on your current support system and how it helps or hinders your recovery.
followUpPrompts: Who do you turn to when you're struggling?
What kind of support do you find most helpful?
Are there people you'd like to include in your support system?
How can you strengthen your existing support relationships?

submodules.title: Communication Patterns
submodules.description: Explore how you communicate about recovery

activities.title: Communication Patterns
activities.description: Reflect on how you communicate about your recovery with others

content.prompt: How do you communicate with others about your recovery journey? Consider what feels comfortable to share, what feels difficult, and how you'd like to improve these conversations.
followUpQuestions: What do you find easy to share with others about your recovery?
What feels difficult or uncomfortable to discuss?
How do you respond when others ask about your recovery?
What would help you feel more comfortable sharing your journey?

reflectionPrompts.title: Family Dynamics
reflectionPrompts.prompt: Consider how your family relationships impact your recovery and well-being.
followUpPrompts: How does your family talk about food, bodies, or health?
What family patterns might influence your relationship with food?
How can you navigate family dynamics that feel challenging?
What would help your family better support your recovery?

submodules.title: Setting Boundaries
submodules.description: Learn to set and maintain healthy boundaries

activities.title: Setting Healthy Boundaries
activities.description: Explore how to set and maintain healthy boundaries in relationships

content.prompt: Healthy boundaries are essential for recovery. Reflect on your current boundaries and how you can strengthen them to protect your recovery and well-being.
followUpQuestions: What boundaries do you currently have in place?
What would healthy boundaries look like for you?
How can you communicate your boundaries effectively?

reflectionPrompts.title: Social Pressures and Expectations
reflectionPrompts.prompt: Reflect on social pressures and expectations that affect your recovery.
followUpPrompts: What social situations feel most challenging for your recovery?
How do you handle comments about food, weight, or appearance?
What social expectations feel difficult to navigate?
How can you stay true to your recovery in social settings?
